content: frankie s knitted stuff daisy chain kit here s a daisy chain that will last all summer the simple crochet flowers have holes in the stems so that they can be threaded together and taken apart again to make bracelets necklaces or whatever you want they are made with double knitting weight yarn and a 3mm crochet hook the flowers make 5ch and work 1dc us single_crochet into the first chain just put your hook down through the middle of the chain to do this it s easy and will keep the crochet flat that s one petal made the other five are made in the same way but beginning with 6ch so … make 6ch and work 1dc into the first chain when you have a strip of six petals join them into a ring and then gather the centre to make a flower the centre of the daisy is embroidered in yellow or perhaps pink bring the yarn up through the centre of the flower and then back down through the gap in one petal repeat this for every petal giving you a star shaped centre which also straightens the petals out the stems make 18ch and beginning with the second chain from the hook work slip stitches into the next 6ch again just put the hook down into the centre of the chain then for the important hole ch3 and miss the next 3 stitches work slip stitches into the rest of the chains sew the stem to the back of the flower attaching it just by its end you could vary the length or position of the hole as you choose that s it really make daisies until you re bored and then join them by threading the stem of one through the stem of another until your chain is long enough to join a chain into a circle thread the head of the first daisy one petal at a time through the stem of the last one a daisy chain kit would make a lovely spring gift for a child or a child at heart of course crochet daisies don t have to be white they look lovely in colour too abbreviations chain chain double_crochet double_crochet us single_crochet © frankie brown 2012 my patterns are for personal use only and should not be used to knit items for sale please do not use them for teaching purposes without my permission
